means.word_mean: 1. order of chiefly tropical marsh-dwelling fish-eating wading birds with long legs and bills and (except for flamingos) unwebbed feet: herons; storks; spoonbills; flamingos; ibises

auth_sentence.content: Storks and long-legged wading birds Storks and other long-legged wading birds form the order Ciconiiformes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Storks and long-legged wading birds Storks and other long-legged wading birds form the order Ciconiiformes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Storks and long-legged wading birds Storks and other long-legged wading birds form the order Ciconiiformes.

auth_sentence.content: To overcome this confusion, it has been proposed to merge the "core" Pelecaniformes into the Ciconiiformes.
